summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons press release announcing the death of inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein. He was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. The FBI is investigating the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, from an apparent suicide. He was indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Lee Plourde
persons.context: The listed contact person for the Federal Bureau of Prisons press release regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m.
His death was described as an 'apparent suicide' in the Special Housing Unit.
Epstein had arrived at the facility on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The FBI is investigating the incident.
The Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York is described as an Administrative security facility housing 763 male offenders.
